feed.title: HEADS UP: Bitcoin 0.9.0 doesn't work on old Linux

entry.title: HEADS UP: Bitcoin 0.9.0 doesn't work on old Linux
entry.summary: The user has upgraded to Bitcoin 0.9.0 but is encountering an error message when trying to run the bitcoind and bitcoin-qt commands. The error message states that versions GLIBC_2.15 and GLIBC_2.14 are required but not found in the system's /lib/libc.so.6 directory. The user is running Red Hat Enterprise Linux, which uses glibc 2.12. The email signature at the end of the message includes contact information for Jesús Cea Avión, as well as a quote from Leibniz about love. A digital signature attachment is also included.
